thread.title: Bengals News: Cam Taylor-Britt ready to bring energy to defense - Cincy Jungle
thread.title_full: Bengals News: Cam Taylor-Britt ready to bring energy to defense - Cincy Jungle

author: PatrickJudis
title: Bengals News: Cam Taylor-Britt ready to bring energy to defense - Cincy Jungle
text: [Quick Hits: It's Ja'Marr's Call If He'll Play; Mike Hilton Looks To Avenge 'One Of Worst Games' Of Career; Taylor-Britt Set To Bring '100%' Juice For Bengals](https://www.bengals.com/news/it-s-ja-marr-s-call-if-he-ll-play-mike-hilton-looks-to-avenge-) "Good question. If I knew I'd be playing," Chase said when asked how close he is to 100%. "I'm getting (range of motion) back. It's going to come down to tolerating pain from a hit, for real. If anything, that will be the biggest test. You can't test that pregame. You'll hurt yourself before you play. We'll find out." [The Conversation: Bengals Rookie WR Andrei Iosivas Emerges: 'If You Gave Me All The Knowledge And Experience I Have Now ...'](https://www.bengals.com/news/the-conversation-andrei-iosivas-emerges-if-you-gave-me-all-the) All career-highs in the middle of the playoff crucible last Saturday in Pittsburgh for Bengals rookie wide receiver Andrei Iosivas with [Pro Bowl](http://www.sbnation.com/nfl-pro-bowl) wide receiver Ja'Marr Chase injured. From snaps (46) to catches (four) to yards (36). [Ja'Marr Chase injury update: Bengals WR returns to practice, takes dig at Chiefs defense ahead of Week 17 game](https://www.cbssports.com/nfl/news/jamarr-chase-injury-update-bengals-wr-returns-to-practice-takes-dig-at-chiefs-defense-ahead-of-week-17-game/) The [Cincinnati Bengals](https://www.cincyjungle.com/) may be getting a big part of their offense back for Sunday's Week 17 showdown against the [Kansas City Chiefs](https://www.arrowheadpride.com). Pro Bowl wideout Ja'Marr Chase returned to practice as a limited participant on Thursday. [Bengals WR Ja'Marr Chase on what stands out about Chiefs secondary: 'Nothing'](https://www.nfl.com/news/bengals-wr-ja-marr-chase-on-what-stands-out-about-chiefs-secondary-nothing) "I don't even know who that is," Chase said. "Is that No. 6? I don't know, man. Just a guy to me. He ain't Jessie Bates to me. You want me to go (into) comparisons? It's not the same. Just saying." [John Hussey assigned to Bengals vs. Chiefs Week 17](https://sports.yahoo.com/john-hussey-assigned-bengals-vs-013507796.html) John Hussey will be the head referee for a Bengals game for the second time this season. The first was when they beat the [Los Angeles Rams](https://www.turfshowtimes.com/) 19-16 on a Monday night in Week 3. Before that, he had also called the Bengals vs. [Steelers](https://www.behindthesteelcurtain.com/) game on Dec. 21, 2020. [Bengals visit Chiefs in AFC title game rematch amid fight for the playoffs](https://www.wcpo.com/sports/football/bengals/bengals-visit-chiefs-in-afc-title-game-rematch-as-both-teams-fight-for-the-playoffs) The Bengals (8-7) have won three of their last four games to keep their AFC wild-card hopes alive, but they desperately need to beat Kansas City (9-6) to give themselves a good shot at making the postseason field. [Chiefs vs. Bengals in Week 17: Must-win for Kansas City?](https://www.foxsports.com/watch/fmc-ff6osfbvyllxq4sk) Kansas City Chiefs TE Travis Kelce said that the Chiefs need to ‘do their job.’ Joy Taylor, and former Chief LeSean McCoy discuss whether or not their matchup against the Cincinnati Bengals is a must-win for Kansas City.
